content.question: Which of the following best explains how a certificate authority is used in protecting data?

choices.label: A certificate authority certifies the safety of a particular Web site so that users know that it does not contain any viruses.
A certificate authority issues passwords that grant access to secure databases.
A certificate authority maintains a secure database that maps all Web domain names to the IP addresses of the servers where the sites are hosted.
A certificate authority verifies the authenticity of encryption keys used in secured communications.

content.answer: A certificate authority verifies the authenticity of encryption keys used in secured communications.
